ayahs.translation_english: In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.
All praise is due to Allah, Lord of the worlds.
The Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.
Sovereign of the Day of Recompense.
It is You we worship and You we ask for help.
Guide us to the straight path.

ayahs.arabic_text: صِرَاطَ الَّذِينَ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ غَيْرِ الْمَغْضُوبِ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا الضَّالِّينَ
ayahs.translation_english: The path of those upon whom You have bestowed favor, not of those who have evoked [Your] anger or of those who are astray.

ayahs.arabic_text: تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي بِيَدِهِ الْمُلْكُ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
ayahs.translation_english: Blessed is He in whose hand is dominion, and He is over all things competent.

ayahs.arabic_text: الَّذِي خَلَقَ الْمَوْتَ وَالْحَيَاةَ لِيَبْلُوَكُمْ أَيُّكُمْ أَحْسَنُ عَمَلًا ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفُورُ
ayahs.translation_english: He who created death and life to test you [as to] which of you is best in deed - and He is the Exalted in Might, the Forgiving.

ayahs.arabic_text: الَّذِي خَلَقَ سَبْعَ سَمَاوَاتٍ طِبَاقًا ۖ مَّا تَرَىٰ فِي خَلْقِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ مِن تَفَاوُتٍ ۖ فَارْجِعِ الْبَصَرَ هَلْ تَرَىٰ مِن فُطُورٍ
ayahs.translation_english: He who created seven heavens in layers. You do not see in the creation of the Most Merciful any inconsistency. So return [your] vision [to the sky]; do you see any breaks?

ayahs.arabic_text: ثُمَّ ارْجِعِ الْبَصَرَ كَرَّتَيْنِ يَنقَلِبْ إِلَيْكَ الْبَصَرُ خَاسِئًا وَهُوَ حَسِيرٌ
ayahs.translation_english: Then return [your] vision twice again. [Your] vision will return to you humbled while it is fatigued.

ayahs.arabic_text: وَلَقَدْ زَيَّنَّا السَّمَاءَ الدُّنْيَا بِمَصَابِيحَ وَجَعَلْنَاهَا رُجُومًا لِّلشَّيَاطِينِ ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لَهُمْ عَذَابَ السَّعِيرِ
ayahs.translation_english: And We have certainly adorned the nearest heaven with stars and have made [from] them what is thrown at the devils and have prepared for them the punishment of the Blaze.

ayahs.arabic_text: وَلِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِرَبِّهِمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ وَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ
ayahs.translation_english: And for those who disbelieved in their Lord is the punishment of Hell, and wretched is the destination.

ayahs.arabic_text: إِذَا أُلْقُوا فِيهَا سَمِعُوا لَهَا شَهِيقًا وَهِيَ تَفُورُ
ayahs.translation_english: When they are thrown into it, they hear from it a [dreadful] inhaling while it boils up.

ayahs.arabic_text: تَكَادُ تَمَيَّزُ مِنَ الْغَيْظِ ۖ كُلَّمَا أُلْقِيَ فِيهَا فَوْجٌ سَأَلَهُمْ خَزَنَتُهَا أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ نَذِيرٌ
ayahs.translation_english: It almost bursts with rage. Every time a company is thrown into it, its keepers ask them, 'Did there not come to you a warner?'

ayahs.arabic_text: قَالُوا بَلَىٰ قَدْ جَاءَنَا نَذِيرٌ فَكَذَّبْنَا وَقُلْنَا مَا نَزَّلَ اللَّهُ مِن شَيْءٍ إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَالٍ كَبِيرٍ
ayahs.translation_english: They will say, 'Yes, a warner had come to us, but we denied and said, 'Allah has not sent down anything. You are not but in great error.''

ayahs.arabic_text: وَقَالُوا لَوْ كُنَّا نَسْمَعُ أَوْ نَعْقِلُ مَا كُنَّا فِي أَصْحَابِ السَّعِيرِ
ayahs.translation_english: And they will say, 'If only we had been listening or reasoning, we would not be among the companions of the Blaze.'
And they will admit their sin, so [away with] the companions of the Blaze.

ayahs.arabic_text: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُم بِالْغَيْبِ لَهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌ وَأَجْرٌ كَبِيرٌ
ayahs.translation_english: Indeed, those who fear their Lord unseen will have forgiveness and great reward.

ayahs.arabic_text: وَأَسِرُّوا قَوْلَكُمْ أَوِ اجْهَرُوا بِهِ ۖ إِنَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ
ayahs.translation_english: And conceal your speech or publicize it; indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

ayahs.arabic_text: أَلَا يَعْلَمُ مَنْ خَلَقَ وَهُوَ اللَّطِيفُ الْخَبِيرُ
ayahs.translation_english: Does He who created not know, while He is the Subtle, the Acquainted?

ayahs.arabic_text: هُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ ذَلُولًا فَامْشُوا فِي مَنَاكِبِهَا وَكُلُوا مِن رِّزْقِهِ ۖ وَإِلَيْهِ النُّشُورُ
ayahs.translation_english: It is He who made the earth subservient to you, so walk among its slopes and eat from His provision - and to Him is the resurrection.

ayahs.arabic_text: أَأَمِنتُم مَّن فِي السَّمَاءِ أَن يَخْسِفَ بِكُمُ الْأَرْضَ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَمُورُ
ayahs.translation_english: Do you feel secure that He who is in the heaven would not cause the earth to swallow you, and suddenly it would sway?

ayahs.arabic_text: أَمْ أَمِنتُم مَّن فِي السَّمَاءِ أَن يُرْسِلَ عَلَيْكُمْ حَاصِبًا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ كَيْفَ نَذِيرِ
ayahs.translation_english: Or do you feel secure that He who is in the heaven would not send against you a storm of stones? Then you will know how was My warning.

ayahs.arabic_text: وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ
ayahs.translation_english: And already had those before them denied, and how [terrible] was My reproach!

ayahs.arabic_text: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا إِلَى الطَّيْرِ فَوْقَهُمْ صَافَّاتٍ وَيَقْبِضْنَ ۚ مَا يُمْسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا الرَّحْمَٰنُ ۚ إِنَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ بَصِيرٌ
ayahs.translation_english: Do they not see the birds above them with wings spread and [sometimes] folded in? None holds them [aloft] but the Most Merciful. Indeed, He is, of all things, Seeing.

ayahs.arabic_text: أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي هُوَ جُندٌ لَّكُمْ يَنصُرُكُم مِّن دُونِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ ۚ إِنِ الْكَافِرُونَ إِلَّا فِي غُرُورٍ
ayahs.translation_english: Or who is it that could be an army for you to aid you other than the Most Merciful? The disbelievers are not but in delusion.

ayahs.arabic_text: أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي يَرْزُقُكُمْ إِنْ أَمْسَكَ رِزْقَهُ ۚ بَل لَّجُّوا فِي عُتُوٍّ وَنُفُورٍ
ayahs.translation_english: Or who is it that could provide for you if He withheld His provision? But they have persisted in insolence and aversion.

ayahs.arabic_text: أَفَمَن يَمْشِي مُكِبًّا عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهِ أَهْدَىٰ أَمَّن يَمْشِي سَوِيًّا عَلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
ayahs.translation_english: Then is he who walks facedown on his face more rightly guided or he who walks erect on a straight path?

ayahs.arabic_text: قُلْ هُوَ الَّذِي أَنشَأَكُمْ وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ السَّمْعَ وَالْأَبْصَارَ وَالْأَفْئِدَةَ ۖ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَشْكُرُونَ
ayahs.translation_english: Say, 'It is He who produced you and made for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful.'

ayahs.arabic_text: قُلْ هُوَ الَّذِي ذَرَأَكُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
ayahs.translation_english: Say, 'It is He who has dispersed you through the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.'

ayahs.arabic_text: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
ayahs.translation_english: And they say, 'When is this promise, if you should be truthful?'

ayahs.arabic_text: قُلْ إِنَّمَا الْعِلْمُ عِندَ اللَّهِ وَإِنَّمَا أَنَا نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
ayahs.translation_english: Say, 'The knowledge is only with Allah, and I am only a clear warner.'

ayahs.arabic_text: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهُ زُلْفَةً سِيئَتْ وُجُوهُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَقِيلَ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِ تَدَّعُونَ
ayahs.translation_english: But when they see it approaching, the faces of those who disbelieve will be distressed, and it will be said, 'This is that for which you used to call.'

ayahs.arabic_text: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَهْلَكَنِيَ اللَّهُ وَمَن مَّعِيَ أَوْ رَحِمَنَا فَمَن يُجِيرُ الْكَافِرِينَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
ayahs.translation_english: Say, 'Have you considered: if Allah should destroy me and those with me or have mercy upon us, then who will protect the disbelievers from a painful punishment?'

ayahs.arabic_text: قُلْ هُوَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ آمَنَّا بِهِ وَعَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
ayahs.translation_english: Say, 'He is the Most Merciful; we have believed in Him, and upon Him we have relied. And you will [come to] know who it is that is in clear error.'

ayahs.arabic_text: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَصْبَحَ مَاؤُكُمْ غَوْرًا فَمَن يَأْتِيكُم بِمَاءٍ مَّعِينٍ
ayahs.translation_english: Say, 'Have you considered: if your water was to become sunken, then who could bring you flowing water?'
When the earth is shaken with its [final] earthquake
And the earth discharges its burdens
And man says, 'What is [wrong] with it?'
That Day, it will report its news
Because your Lord has inspired it.

ayahs.arabic_text: يَوْمَئِذٍ يَصْدُرُ النَّاسُ أَشْتَاتًا لِّيُرَوْا أَعْمَالَهُمْ
ayahs.translation_english: That Day, the people will depart separated [into categories] to be shown [the result of] their deeds.

ayahs.arabic_text: فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًا يَرَهُ
ayahs.translation_english: So whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it.

ayahs.arabic_text: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّا يَرَهُ
ayahs.translation_english: And whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it.
By the galloping, panting steeds,
Striking sparks of fire,
And charging in the morning,
Raising thereby [clouds of] dust,
And entering thereby into the center [of the enemy's camp],
Indeed, mankind is to his Lord ungrateful.
And indeed, he is to that a witness.
And indeed he is, in love of wealth, intense.

ayahs.arabic_text: أَفَلَا يَعْلَمُ إِذَا بُعْثِرَ مَا فِي الْقُبُورِ
ayahs.translation_english: But does he not know that when the contents of the graves are scattered
And that within the breasts is obtained,
Indeed, their Lord with them, that Day, is [fully] Acquainted.
The Striking Calamity -
What is the Striking Calamity?
And what can make you know what is the Striking Calamity?
It is the Day when a man will be like dispersed moths
And the mountains will be like carded wool.
Then as for one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds],
He will be in a pleasant life.
But as for one whose scales are light,
His refuge will be an abyss.
And what can make you know what that is?
A Fire, intensely hot.
Competition in worldly increase diverts you
Until you visit the graveyards.
No! You are going to know.
Then no! You are going to know.
No! If you only knew with knowledge of certainty...
You will surely see the Hellfire.
Then you will surely see it with the eye of certainty.
Then you will surely be asked that Day about pleasure.
By the declining day,
Indeed, mankind is in loss,

ayahs.arabic_text: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ
ayahs.translation_english: Except for those who have believed and done righteous deeds and advised each other to truth and advised each other to patience.
Woe to every slanderer, backbiter,
Who collects wealth and [continuously] counts it.
He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal.
No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher.
And what can make you know what is the Crusher?
It is the fire of Allah, kindled,
Which mounts directed at the hearts.
Indeed, it will be closed upon them
In extended columns.

ayahs.arabic_text: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصْحَابِ الْفِيلِ
ayahs.translation_english: Have you not considered, [O Muhammad], how your Lord dealt with the companions of the elephant?
Did He not make their plan into misguidance?
And He sent against them birds in flocks,
Striking them with stones of hard clay,
And He made them like eaten straw.
For the accustomed security of the Quraysh,
Their accustomed security [in] the caravan of winter and summer -
Let them worship the Lord of this House,

ayahs.arabic_text: الَّذِي أَطْعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٍ وَآمَنَهُم مِّنْ خَوْفٍ
ayahs.translation_english: Who has fed them, [saving them] from hunger and made them safe, [saving them] from fear.
Have you seen the one who denies the religion?
For that is the one who drives away the orphan
And does not encourage the feeding of the poor.
So woe to those who pray
Those who are heedless of their prayer -
Those who make show [of their deeds]
And withhold [small] assistance.
Indeed, We have granted you, [O Muhammad], al-Kawthar.
So pray to your Lord and sacrifice [to Him alone].
Indeed, your enemy is the one cut off.
Say, 'O disbelievers,
I do not worship what you worship.
Nor are you worshipers of what I worship.
Nor will I be a worshiper of what you worship.
Nor will you be worshipers of what I worship.
For you is your religion, and for me is my religion.'
When the victory of Allah has come and the conquest,

ayahs.arabic_text: وَرَأَيْتَ النَّاسَ يَدْخُلُونَ فِي دِينِ اللَّهِ أَفْوَاجًا
ayahs.translation_english: And you see the people entering into the religion of Allah in crowds,

ayahs.arabic_text: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَاسْتَغْفِرْهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ تَوَّابًا
ayahs.translation_english: Then exalt [Him] with praise of your Lord and ask forgiveness of Him. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of repentance.
May the hands of Abu Lahab be ruined, and ruined is he.

ayahs.arabic_text: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُ مَالُهُ وَمَا كَسَبَ
ayahs.translation_english: His wealth will not avail him or that which he gained.
He will [enter to] burn in a Fire of [blazing] flame
And his wife [as well], the carrier of firewood.
Around her neck is a rope of [twisted] fiber.
Say, 'He is Allah, [who is] One,
Allah, the Eternal Refuge.
He neither begets nor is born,
Nor is there to Him any equivalent.'
Say, 'I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak
From the evil of that which He created
And from the evil of darkness when it settles
And from the evil of the blowers in knots
And from the evil of an envier when he envies.'
Say, 'I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind,
The Sovereign of mankind.
The God of mankind,
From the evil of the retreating whisperer -
Who whispers into the breasts of mankind -
From among the jinn and mankind.'
